data.user_input: greeting: Hi! type: essay audience: general public goal: (not provided) feedback: (not provided) text: I wrote a short paragraph about climate change. Weather is effecting farmers alot. The data are scattered and I was going to add more later. It's kind of messy, and I don't know if its good.

goal: strengthen thesis clarity and persuasive impact type: argumentative essay audience: high school teacher feedback: line-by-line edits and overview text: School uniforms should be adopted because they reduce bullying. However my thesis is vague and I don't consistently support claims. I want stronger transitions and a clearer stance.

goal: refine tone for professional readers type: business letter audience: potential clients feedback: comprehensive edits text: Dear Sir or Madam, I hope this email finds you well. We offer services that is tailored to your needs, and we want to ensure your satisfaction, we will be happy to help. Please let me know if you have any question.

goal: convey authenticity while staying concise type: personal statement audience: college admissions committee feedback: detailed critique text: Growing up in a small town taught me resilience and curiosity. I want to show my passion for biology without sounding arrogant. I'm not sure if my anecdotes connect to my central message or if the tone fits my audience.

goal: fix spelling errors and polish tone type: cover letter audience: hiring manager feedback: spelling-focused text: I am definately interested in the position and hope to recieve a response soon. I managed seperate projects where delays occured frequently, but I adapted quickly. My resume highlights my acheivements.

goal: improve grammar clarity type: reflective essay audience: teacher feedback: grammar-focused text: The results shows that I was successful in the project. I was working on the report and finish it yesterday. Running quickly, the finish line seemed far. The team were excited, we celebrated and it was great.

goal: comprehensive improvements type: analytical essay audience: classmates feedback: thorough edits text: The experiment was sucssesful but kind of messy. The data is inconsistent and we was recording at different times. Also, I think the intro could be shorter. This study have many limitations. Overall, it's good.

goal: standardize tense and tone type: narrative essay audience: general readers feedback: focus on tense and style text: Yesterday I walk to the beach and I am watching the waves; later I will wrote about it. I'm gonna add more details because it felt awesome, but the structure is all over the place and I start with the ending. The style switches between casual and formal.

goal: improve organization type: research summary audience: instructor feedback: structural suggestions text: paragraph1: The results section lists three key findings, then I introduce my research question. paragraph2: Background information appears after the conclusion, and some duplicated points appear in both sections. paragraph3: Methods are briefly mentioned at the end, although they should be earlier.

goal: boost persuasiveness type: opinion essay audience: local newspaper readers feedback: guidance on development text: Our city should invest in parks. The benefits are many, but I don't provide examples, statistics, or comparisons. Transitions between paragraphs are weak and the tone shifts abruptly. I want advice beyond fixing errors.
greeting: Hi there!; question: What can you do to help with my essay draft?

writing type: persuasive essay; instructions: Please edit line-by-line and give feedback.; writing: School lunches is healthy but they taste bad and students is complaining. I think the policy should change though I don't know how.

instructions: Please use the exact headings Overall Feedback, Spelling Edits, Grammar Edits, Structural Suggestions, Opportunities for Improvement, Formatting Guidance.; writing type: letter of complaint; writing: Dear manager, The product arrived broke. I am very upset and it do not work, please refund.

goals: persuade the high school committee; audience: teachers and principal; instructions: Include an 'Overall Feedback' section summarizing themes aligned to my goals and audience.; writing type: speech draft; writing: Students are complaining about too much homework, I argue that homework is necessary but also we needs balance.

instructions: Provide detailed 'Spelling Edits' with bullet points naming misspellings and corrected spellings.; writing type: narrative; writing: I went to the libary to meet my freind. It was definetly a suprise when they didn't show.
instructions: In a 'Grammar Edits' section, itemize issues and provide corrected versions with explanations.; writing: I was going, then I go to the store, and buyed apples that is fresh.
instructions: Suggest changes with explanations of issue type and rationale.; writing: My story begins with a boy who are dreams to be a astronaut, he maybe will became one someday.
instructions: Fix tense, dialect, style, and structure inconsistencies.; writing: Yesterday I go to market and we be shopping. The essay jump around, I write in casual slang, then formal.

instructions: Give 'Structural Suggestions' with concrete reordering and trimming and explain effects on coherence.; writing: Intro: I love science. Body: My experiments sometimes fail and sometimes success. Conclusion: Science is cool.

instructions: In 'Opportunities for Improvement', propose enhancements beyond error correction and mention clarity, evidence, examples, transitions, tone.; writing: The argument say climate change is real but I don't provide any data and the paragraphs is choppy.
